title: Issues with deleting League of Legends Folder
body:
Hi guys,

Hopefully someone can help me. I have had issues with my client for a while now, but this update the client as it is scanning for files, an error comes up stopping the update. Because of this I decided to delete the league of legends folder and add an older client I had from a portable hardrive. Unfortunately it refuses to delete the folder as it says "Unable to delete as it is in use". 
I have restarted my computer, and I have checked the task manager and there are no signs of the folder being used. Because of this I am having to run the game from a portable hardrive but would love to delete the game so I am able to reinstall it to remove all of these issues I am having.

Cheers guys.

replies.body:
Hi ncox,

Check out the [Reinstalling League of Legends](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202539040-Reinstalling-League-of-Legends) steps - there might be a couple of steps in there that you need to do to get rid of everything.

Cheers
Mindstar
I have tried this, using control panel to uninstall. League of legends file isn't there.

There could be a couple of other things holding access to that folder.  Have you also uninstalled Pando Media Booster?  Do you have an antivirus system that might be accessing the folder when you try to delete?

No I have not uninstalled Pando Media Booster to my knowledge, but it's not present in the control panel to be uninstalled either which is odd. No, there shouldn't be anything causing the folder to be saying it's being used.

Thanks for the update.

It is a bit puzzling what might be blocking you from removing that folder.  There could be any number of things on your PC that might be preventing you from deleting it so here are a couple of suggestions I can think of to help you investigate further:

* Log in as as an administrator to delete the folder
* Try out a tool like [process explorer](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/sysinternals/bb896653.aspx), 
 * search for the League path by clicking "Find" -> "Find handle/dll" and type the folder path (eg: "C:\Riot Games\") 
 * The resulting list should show you which processes are accessing files in that path.
* Boot into windows [safe mode](http://windows.microsoft.com/en-au/windows/start-computer-safe-mode#start-computer-safe-mode=windows-7) and try deleting the folder from there.

Let me know how you go or if you have any other questions.

Cheers
Mindstar

Already logged in as administrator that unfortunately didn't work.
No Riot games folder in the C drive, have it on my desktop.
Safe mode wont allow it to be deleted either. 
Thanks

Sorry perhaps I wasn't quite clear above.
You should use process explorer to examine the folder you're trying to delete.  That will tell you what process is using a file underneath that path.

In your case, the path you would search for, using process explorer would be something similar to
"C:\users\YOUR-USERNAME\desktop\LEAGUE-FOLDER-NAME"   (replace the caps with the correct names)

If this doesn't turn up anything, I'd strongly suggest sending in a ticket to player support, as they have tech specialists who will be able to help you way better than I can.
